content.description: Interesting mix of chimney, stemming, and face climbing with great exposure up high.
content.protection: Bolts. Bring lots of draws (12 or 13?)
content.location: First route to the left of the easy 4th/5th class route to the top of Lizard Tail Spire.

climbs.name: Mac Daddy
climbs.fa: Matt Heinen, Mac Carroll & John Knight

content.description: A steep, 2 pitch route with a variety of interesting moves. P1 is a bit harder with a mix of bolts and trad placements and goes about mid 5.10. P2 is slightly easier at low 5.10 and is all bolted. The crux for P1 is above the limestone band and involves some tricky, but good, trad placements. The crux for P2 is right off the belay.
content.protection: Rack of singles and lots of draws.
content.location: Left of Lizard Tail Spire. After passing the easy 4th/5th class route to the top of Lizard Tail, head uphill for a few more minutes.

content.description: Sunny, west facing wall with lots of potential climbs in the 5.9 to 5.10+ range.
